dialogues.text: If you just joined us, today's topic is "my father is evi and wants to take over the world". Now, Bobby, you had  something you wanted to share with your father before the break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Scott, tell us about your father.  Share with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he's the head of an evil  organization that has aspirations  for world domination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where is your father right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in outer space, like frozen in  a giant egg and stuffed inside a Big  Boy rocket with his cat, Mr.  Bigglesworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Well, we have a surprise for  you, Scott. Let's bring out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: father, Dr Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Scott, I'm back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you'd do this to me  on national television!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They offered me a free makeover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil, we've seen a lot of the  fathers here today open up to their  sons, sons to the fathers. Is there  anything you'd like to share?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Share?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, don't you have any secrets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. I have a vestigial tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is a little grossed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more of a nub, really. The spine  just goes on a little longer than it  should. Also, I've dabbled. I mean,  perform fellatio once and you're a  poet, twice and you're a homosexual.  I remember once I was being fisted  by Sebastian Cabot- but here's where  the story gets interesting. He was  lactose-intolerant. He could eat red  meat all night long, but one sip of  milk and it was gastric hell. And I  remember we were caught in fragrance  delicto by Henry Kissinger, and you  can imagine my humiliation at having  Hank hear me say, "Mr. French, no  teeth." One of my greatest  disappointments is that I never became  a song and dance man. I could have  been a quadruple threat, kind of  like a despotic Ken Barry. Dancer,  singer, actor, and I would possess  nuclear weapons, the latter being  the most threatening of the four. I  once sat on a bus and tried to will  myself a menstrual cycle. All I ended  up with was a sense of failure and a  mild neuralgia in my incisor teeth  and perhaps a grudging respect for  the weaker sex. I love toe cleavage.  For the most part I distrust dogs. I  slept in a horse once. It was quite  roomy. On second thought, it was the  Ritz. I named my left testicle 'piss'  and my right testicle 'vinegar'. I  wrote "It's Raining Men", or so the  Christmas babies told me. Oh yes, I  also made a Marzipan voodoo effigy  of The Fonze while I was in coma  after smoking some Peruvian prayer  hash, but who at the end of the day  can honestly say they haven't done  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: We pan up a modern office building. The camera reaches th top of the building and we see a giant STARBUCKS LOGO and the words: Starbucks World Headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The penthouse boardroom is adorned with Starbucks  paraphernalia: large logo, clear canisters full of beans, and a large world map with a little logo everywhere there a Starbucks. Around a large table are Dr. Evil, Number Two (bandaged a lightly spotted with soot), Frau, Scott and a couple of N HENCHMEN. A Starbucks employee serves everyone steaming h coffee products.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil, as the legitimate frontman  of your organization, I seized upon  the opportunity to invest in a small  Seattle-based coffee company several  years ago. Today, Starbucks is a far- flung empire with 2000 outlets  worldwide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good, Number Two, I do enjoy a  good cuppa joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I may continue, I believe if we  shift our resources away from world  domination and focus on providing  premium quality coffee drinks, we  can increase our gross profits  fivefold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil takes a sip of cappuccino, leaving a WHITE FROTH MILK MUSTACHE on his upper lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Perhaps you've confused me  with someone who gives a shit.  Might  I remind you that I run the show  here? I demand a little respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Dr. Evil's  milk mustache) Dr. Evil, I think you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Number Two smiles weakly, breaking into a sweat on his br

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Dr. Evil, perhaps I have the  answer. While you were frozen, we  began a program to clone you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that the source of the shadow is a MINIATURE DR. E just like the creepy mini-Marlon Brando in The Island of Moreau. He mimics Dr. Evil's mannerisms including holding his tiny pinky to his tiny mouth.

dialogues.text: Breathtaking. I shall call him Mini- Me. (to clone) Mini-Me, you will sit to my right.

dialogues.text: Mini-me, something to eat? (expectant pause) No? (pause) OK. (to room) Tired.  Gentleman, I have a plan. As  you know, the most powerful man in  the world is the President of the  United States. But he is just that-  a man, subject to temptations of the  flesh like any other man. Here's  what we do: we make it seem that the  President has had "extra-marital  oral relations" with- and this is  the kicker-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ri-goddamn-diculous. Oh well,  how about a frickin' time machine?  Does the president have a time  machine? Have I been scooped on that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, time machine it is. As you  know, every diabolical scheme I've  hatched has been thwarted by Austin  Powers. And why is that, ladies and  gentlemen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you never kill him when you  get the chance and you're a dope?

dialogues.text: Mini-Me hops upon the table and tries to push the "Scott  Evil" button on Dr. Evil's control panel. Frau SQUIRTS him with a water bottle. Mini-Me glares at S and GIVES HIM THE FINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, because Austin Powers has "mojo".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: No, no, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Dr. Evil, wouldn't it be easier to  use your knowledge of the future to  play the stock market? We could  literally make trillions.

dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why think small is all I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, I give you the  time portal. As you know, Austin  Powers was frozen in 1967. Therefore,  I time travel to 1969, two years  after he was frozen. Security will  be lax and I'll strike when he is  totally helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, I take Austin Powers' mojo. Then I begin my domina of the world.

dialogues.text: Can I come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Scott, Daddy has a score to  settle. Austin Powers is the snake  to my mongoose, or the mongoose to  my snake. Either way it's bad, I  don't know animals. But I do know  this: This time it's personal. Frau,  Number 2, I'll see you both in 1969.  Come, Mini-Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil walks to the portal. Mini-Me follows, imitating perfectly. They enter the portal. There is a FREEZE FRAME effect and they FADE AWAY, like i Star Trek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil and Mini-Me emerge on the other side of the port into a NEW LAIR. It is a large hollowed-out volcano room  dominated by chrome conduits and tasteful art pieces. A  younger Frau sits with NUMBER TWO, now played by ROB LOWE an eye-patch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, here we are Mini-Me, 1969. Number  Two, you look very youthful and  healthy. (turning to Frau) And Frau you look...right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dr. Evil walks to the center of the room, chairs rise  from the floor. Everyone takes a seat, but Dr. Evil gets  caught in the middle as chairs rise around him. He is  frightened. One of the rising chairs hits him in the crot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, people, we now officially have a  chair problem. If another one of  these chairs hits me in the nuts,  I'm gonna go postal. Mini-Me, I want  you to meet Number Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini-me says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini-Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shy. Low blood sugar. (to room) Gentlemen, Phase Two is beginning. I  have an operative inside the Ministry  of Defense. By this time tomorrow,  Austin Powers' mojo will be mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Yessir! (sotto after the  Colonel) I outta smash your teeth out with a  Toffee Hammer Mr. English Colonel  Telling-Me-What-To-Do-And-Stealing- our-Oil-Refusing-To-Recognize- our- Scottish-Independence!

He bores through the ice and pulls out a Sixties high-tec syringe type device with an LED graph on the side. He pla it in Austin's navel. The LED meter goes from red to gree indicating FULL MOJO.

dialogues.text: Austin drives in MODERN TRAFFIC. He is drinking a STARBUC COFFEE and listening to the Jag's in-dash CD PLAYER. Sudd Austin DROOPS. The car starts to sputter. The fuel gauge  reads empty.

dialogues.text: Gor blimey, I'm on empty! That's  funny, I just filled the Shaguar up  this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be doing a photo shoot. We  know that one of the models is an ex- KGB agent selling top secret material  to the highest bidder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds easy enough, you know  what they say: all work and no  shagging makes Austin a dull boy,  man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good on ya. I don't know what that  means but it sounds fab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guru, we need some advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your horses and any other beasts- of burden. I must lead my disciples  in meditation and then I will help  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guru walks to the front of the room and the disciples sink to their knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is the Guru Pitka. I am a  spiritual teacher and I have combined  many disparate disciplines into a  unified movement of human potentiality  and equipoise that I learned from my  guru, the late Guru Shastri, a chaste  man who died mysteriously of a disease  that strangely had all the hallmarks  of syphilis. He would say to me,  Sparky, love is all, life is breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, perhaps you are wondering where  I got the nickname Sparky.  Well,  when we were young we used to play a  game called "Stinkmop". We would  urinate into a bucket, dip a mop  into it, and play tag. I did not  care for "Stinkmop" and a very wise  old man said to me 'oh lighten up,  Sparky', and I don't know, the name  kind of stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, the reason I am a spiritualist  instead of a therapist is that  'therapist' often becomes 'the rapist'  and that will not help us attain  potentiality. Now what is  potentiality? It is the ability to  achieve those goals that we wish to  achieve for ourselves. People often  say to me that they feel "nowhere",  and I am going to change that to  "Now here."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guru holds up a card which says "NOWHERE = NOW HERE!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have many assumptions about  your goals, but when you "assume"  You make an "ass" out of "u" and  "me".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guru holds up a card which says "ASSUME = ASS - U - ME."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhh....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The being, or that which we call  'ourselves', is not the tinker.  It  is not the taughts. It is the Gap  between the tinker and the taughts!  We are not our mind, we are not our  body, we are the Gap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guru holds up a card that says "NOT TINKER, NOT TAUGHTS, THE GAP" with the familiar Gap font.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rapid fire) The heart of the matter is that you  are the heart of the matter.  There  is no "I" in "team". Beer before  liquor, never sicker. Don't take a  wooden nickel.  If your pipe is short  and your pump is weak, you better  stand close or you'll piss on your  feet. He who goes to bed with itchy  bum wakes up with smelly finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the path to spiritual  awakening requires the death of ego.  Leggo of my ego! Let us end with the  mantra: Om Ay Vant Yu Uh... Mo Ay  Vant Yu Uh... Mo Ay Vant Yu Hu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chanting) Om Ay Vant Yu Uh... Mo Ay Vant Yu  Uh... Mo Ay Vant Yu Hu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guru takes a swig of Yoo-Hoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with God, and pay at the door  please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The disciples file out. Austin and Felicity approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guru, I'm having trouble performing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know- my bits and pieces are a  bit sleepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've forgotten the steps to the Mummy- Daddy dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still not clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My flag's at half mast and no one  will salute it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Willie don't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you beating around the bush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhhh, I get it. (beat) No, I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's impotent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, easy. (to Guru) Felicity and I were all set for some  hump Olympics and I couldn't bat for  six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea what I'm saying, do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guru, I've lost my mojo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, mojo! You should have said so.  Well, you've lost your mojo because  your chakras are misaligned. You  have lost love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost love? Oh, you mean Vanessa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Vanessa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was an evil robot minion of Dr.  Evil. I couldn't have loved her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denial ain't just a river in Egypt,  buddy. You will only get your mojo  back when you surround yourself with  love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I get what you're saying now!  He's talking about free love, baby!  Tune in, turn on, and drop out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am talking about true love. You  must stay and study until you are  worthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, man. The only way to surround  yourself with love is to throw a  swinging shin-dig! Yeah, baby, yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil and Frau are interrupted by the man we now know FAT BASTARD. He is foul-mouthed, and when he swears he is bleeped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Fat Bastard. May I have  the mojo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First things first, where's your  shitter? I've gotta bleepin, turtle  head pokin' out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Right. Charming. Fat Bastard- you  don't mind me calling you Fat Bastard  do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a lot of demons kickin'  around in my noggin, but weight issues  ain't one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Fatty-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name is Fat Bastard!  I'm the  incorrect weight for my height and I  was born out of wedlock, hence the  moniker Fat Bastard. Hey, I'm not  kiddin'. I've got a crap on deck  that could choke a donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat Bastard, the mojo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my (bleeping) money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gentlemen never discusses money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, you can take your (bleep)in'  money and shove it up your (bleep),  you stupid (bleeping) prick! While  you're at it you can suck my greasy,  two-toned (bleep)!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Vulgarity is no substitute for wit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Bleep) you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Bring in the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil PRIVATE ARMY SOLDIERS drive in a forklift loaded with gold bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, here it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat Bastard slowly draws out the high-tech syringe full o MOJO. Dr. Evil is mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini-Me, fetch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini-Me runs and snatches the mojo from Fat Bastard and g it to Dr. Evil, who caresses it and places it on a SPECIA PREPARED PEDESTAL. NUMBER TWO enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil, I have some bad news. Austin  Powers is back in the Sixties. One  of our best assassins spotted him  but he got away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ri-goddamn-diculous, we have  his mojo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another. Felicity Shagwell,  CIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Scott Evil enters through TIME PORTAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I was sitting around  watching the tube and The Courtship  of Eddie's Father came on Nick at  Nite, you know, and I was just  listening to that theme song-- (hums/sings the theme) Anyway it made me think that maybe  we could try and work things out.  You know, you are my Dad and I need  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had your chance, Scott. I already  have someone created in my image.  He's evil, he wants to take over the  world, and he fits easily into most  overhead storage bins. (looking around) Has anyone seen Mini-Me? (calling out) Mini-Me! Mini-Mouse? Mini-Driver?  Hello! Mini Pearl? Can we put a  frickin' bell on him or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, very hurt, sits back in his chair and sulks. Dr. E hits a button and a model moon and a model earth descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, phase three. We place a  giant laser on the moon. Let me  demonstrate. (beat) Where's my laser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil looks around and sees Mini-Me gnawing on the mod laser. Dr. Evil takes it from his mouth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mini-Me, don't chew my laser. (to room) Not feeling well. He has an ear  infection, but tit's OK. (pause) No? Nothing? (back to model) Anyway, the laser is powerful enough  to destroy every city on the planet  at will. We'll turn the moon into  what I like to call a "Death Star".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott SNICKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snickering again) Nothing Darth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. (pretends to sneeze) Rip-off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure) Bless you? Anyways, since my "death  star" laser was invented by the noted  Cambridge physicist, Dr. Parsons. I  thought we'd name it in his honor--  the Alan Parsons Project.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott SNICKERS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alan Parsons Project was a  progressive rock band from 1982.   Why don't you just name it Operation  Wang Chung, ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating laser) When you get your own evil empire,  you can call it whatever you want.   Gentlemen, allow me to demonstrate  the awesome lethality of the Alan  Parsons Project. Fire the laser!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant laser beam smashes down through the roof of the W House, causing it to explode. Everyone is shocked by the laser's power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, Dr. Evil, you destroyed the  Wihite House with no warning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, that was just footage from  the 1996 blockbuster motion Picture  Independence Day, but it would be a  lot like that. What do you think,  Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Codename: Thompson Twins was  really impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm nineteen, I don't-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh! Shh-Shh. Shh-Shhhhhh-Shh. Shh- shh! It's Morse code. (reading imaginary  paper) Let me decipher... it says 'shhhhh!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so lame-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like Electric Company) Ssssss...huuuuuh...Shhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil, what are we going to do  about Powers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat Bastard, in addition to being  extremely rotund, you're a vicious  killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be my pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an easy job. Without his mojo,  Powers will be...powerless?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A party, packed with dancing freaks of every stripe, is i full swing. A girl dances in an oversized birdcage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shag-in is gonna blow your mind,  baby, yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party sequence is shot like Laugh-In. Very fast cuts the music. Austin sees a VERY PREGNANT WOMAN drinking a martini and  smoking.  He gently lifts her drink and cigarette away fr her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll thank me later, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another angle. Austin and Felicity dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing someone) Hey! Ricardo Monteblan, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see RICARDO MONTEBLAN -smoking a hukka on a round chai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Austin! Balls, said the queen  and the king laughed because he had  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to camera) Crazy, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's split up and scope the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do anything I wouldn't do- at  least not without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicity slaps Austin on the butt as he walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, behave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin at the bar with an exotic-looking mod chick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to chick) You're very exotic, baby. Do you  have a little English in you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Alan Zeus-type very gay guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling his eyes) This is ridiculous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONDON COP and Felicity are on hanging chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been picked up by the  fuzz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I bet it really hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUY IN A RAINCOAT on a tricycle, shot undercranked, rid through the party and falls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin pops into frame with a book that says "AUSTIN POWE SEXY DICTIONARY".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Austin Powers Sexy Dictionary  defines an Eskimo hooker as a frosty  prosty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eskimo at the bar in a fur parka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to camera) I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans up Felicity's cool hip-huggers, which are very tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are skin tight. How do you get  into those pants, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you can start by buying me a  drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin does a spit take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicity with a VIKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great last night. By the  way, I'm Thor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Thor? I'm tho thor I can hardly  thit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin is wearing a silly spiked German helmet like in Ho Heroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German accent) Hello, I am Baron Von Firstinbed.  Last night I had German-Chinese food.  An hour later I was hungry- for power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh puh-leez, why don't you take a  handful of F-off pills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear about the contortionist  who was engaged to be married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard she broke it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Film running backwards of Austin doing a spit take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTIE JOHNSON in German helmet behind a plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verrrrry interesting- but shtupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin takes his glasses off to clean them. We see his PO which is totally fuzzy. He looks over and sees what appea to be a NUDE GIRL- two round globes and dark triangle. Austin puts his glasses on and looks again. It is actuall girl in a flesh-colored dress. In between her and Austin  were two COMPLETELY BALD MEN and a triangular martini gla filled with a Cosmopolitan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to Austin and Felicity together again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to where Fat Bastard and his companion are  standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a pretty sight. Who is  he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until recently he worked security  for the MOD, but we think he might  be a double agent, possibly for Dr.  Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've noticed that his lifestyle has  changed dramatically. He's made a  lot of cash purchases, he's hanging  out with foxes half his age, and  he's becomes quite a fixture on the  London party circuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but it looks like he's  splitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat Bastard exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll follow him. You see what you  can get out of the girl. We'll  rendezvous later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicity follows Fat Bastard out the door. Austin makes h way over to the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Powers. Fab party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you today, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin. Robin Swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swallows? That's an interesting name.  Are you English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: German, actually. My maiden name is  Spitz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well which is it, baby, Spitz or  Swallows? Either way, it's a pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pleasure is mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She extends her hand. Austin takes it and shakes. As he  shakes, her cleavage undulates like jello. Austin is  transfixed and keeps shaking far too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charmed, I'm sure. (still shaking, her  breasts jiggle) How do you do? (still shaking,  jiggling) Yes, quite. (shakes, jiggles) I always enjoy meeting new people. (shakes, jiggles) How's your mum? Good. (shakes, jiggles) I love shaking hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin. is shaking her hand so vigorously that she is in  danger of popping out of her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping out of it) So, who was your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Fat Bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It suits him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my lover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin is grossed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Would you happen to know if he's  in business with a man named Mr.  Evil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anyone named Dr. Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I said Mister Evil. Austin  does a smug take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something to drink? Would you like a  Mister Pepper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'd love a Doctor Pepper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I said Mister Pepper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin does another smug take. Robin grabs Austin and pul him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a groovy boy, I'd like to  strap you on sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, behave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Literally a window in a wall. Fat Bastard is placing his  order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I'll have a fried-prawn  sandwich, with extra mayonnaise, two  whole chickens, a kidney pie, a toad  in the hole, bubble and squeak,  bangers and mash, 3 orders of fish  and chips, and... a Fresca. No ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan to see Felicity beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love a man with a large appetite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I love a woman with big (bleeps),  so let's shut up and get to (bleep)ing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicity swallows hard and forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's the question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Would you like to shag?  Would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to, Mr. Powers, just come  right... over... here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin moves Austin into place as they dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a bit of alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Austin looks into her eyes and sees the REFLEC OF AN ASSASSIN (Oedipus) about to throw a knife. Just as he throws it, Austin spins Robin Swallows around USES HER AS A SHIELD. She takes the knife squarely in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strained) Oedipus... use the revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oedipus pulls out a pistol and begins FIRING. Austin cont to use Robin AS A SHIELD. She takes six hits. Oedipus run out of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strained) Oedipus... use the machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oedipus pulls out a machine gun and FIRES. In a Robert  Rodriquez- like flurry of events, Austin dodges while sti USING HER AS A SHIELD. Oedipus throws down his gun and charges Austin. Austin us Robin's body to block Oedipus's head butt, but his moment pushes all three of them through a PLATE GLASS WINDOW of second story loft.

dialogues.speaker: IN MID-AIR
dialogues.text: As they fall, Austin turns Robin around so that she is be him and the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They land with a THUD. Robin cushions Austin's fall. Oedi is dead on the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oedipus, Oedipus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry baby, too late. He's as dead  as vaudeville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't win, Powers. Dr. Evil has  your mojo and it's only a matter of  time before he kills you and takes  over the world. (weak) Tell Fat Bastard I'll miss him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicity is in bed, naked under the sheets, smoking a  cigarette.  We hear strange sounds offstage. We pan over to reveal she's IN BED WITH A NAKED FAT BASTA He is eating a huge turkey leg, his face covered in food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always get (bleep)in' hungry after  I get my end away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never would have thought that a  man of such tremendous girth could  be such a, um, creative and sensuous  lover!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some chicken? I have more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls over to reveal his HUGE NAKED ASS. Felicity takes a homing device out of her purse, looks ar for a place to plant it. She sees his enormous butt cleav and realizes that there's only one place for the thing to go. ANGLE on FAT BASTARD'S face. He is delighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frisky are we? Alright lets have  another go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil at his table with Frau, Scott, and Number Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the President of the United  States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRESIDENT appears on Dr. Evil's video screen with his ADVISORS behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil, what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not what I want Mr. President, but I  will receive. In 12 hours I will  destroy Washington, DC with a giant  laser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil reveals a giant laser. Mini-Me is humping it lik dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, Mini-Me, why don't you and the  laser get a frickin' room. Honestly. (to President) I will destroy another major city  every hour- that is, unless you pay me-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hundred billion dollars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President and his advisors LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil that's more than the entire  federal budget for 1969.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play games with me. The capitol  will disappear if I don't receive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hundred billion dollars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His advisors LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That much money simply doesn't exist.  I don't think l00 billion is even a  number. It's like saying I want a  kajillion bajillion dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His advisors LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mr. President...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Show me the money!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil looks around smugly. No one laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Show me the money!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around again, expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, kwan? Show me the money?  No? Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 1969. That movie won't come out  for another 30 years, ass.  They  don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. OK, see if you understand  this: give me the money or I'm going  to blow you to frickin' bits, OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President and his advisors MURMUR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making 'stop' gesture) Talk to the hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil signs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Scott) I did love that, though. Cuba Gooding  Jr. was outstanding. Oscar speech,  very touching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott looks at him with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody clear the room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone leaves and he walks over to a panel bearing his  logo. He presses a button, the panel opens up to reveal..

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SHRINE TO AUSTIN POWERS
dialogues.text: In it we see a huge full-length photo of Austin Powers, a various magazine covers. He presses a button and an Austin wig descends from the  ceiling landing perfectly on his bald head. A backless mo of Austin's suit rises from the floor. He puts on a pair glasses. He has become Austin Powers. Dr. Evil cautiously tastes the mojo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, baby. Very shagedelic. (beat) This isn't working. I don't feel  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH IN towards Dr. Evil's head.

dialogues.speaker: DR. EVIL ANIMATED SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: A Yellow Submarine-like depiction of Dr. Evil. Zoom in on his head which explodes into 30 other small Dr. Evil head which rain on a Peter Max-ian valley of flowers. The flow sprout the word "EVIL'. A psychedelic flying Austin head with spirals in the glas smashes the flowers, changing the words from "EVIL" to "V and to "LIVE" and then to "LOVE". Turn-of-the-century fat cat capitalists on stilts with te coming out of their stomachs drop penis rockets that have the word "GREED" written on the shaft, smashing the "LOVE flowers into "IRELO" which sprouts into "YELLOW" which tu into submarines, which becomes yellow penises of huge, go stepping Dr. Evils, each of them peeing, creating a rain urine that falls on the Peter Max-ian valley of a hundred Austin Powers citizens. They each open an umbrella that s "LOVE TRIUMPHS OVER LUST". The urine turns into a stream  that flows into the mouth of a huge head of Dr. Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back from Dr. Evil's head. He looks dazed and confus Just then, Number Two re-enters the room, catching Dr. Ev with all his Austin paraphernalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil, one last thing. I-- oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just... right. Would it kill  you to frickin' knock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Felicity walk along the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, tell me about the Nineties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can't tell you details  about the future, baby, it could  alter history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not details, just what it's like.  You know, what's the scene?  Where's  it at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There've been a lot of advances in  the Nineties, baby. The economy is  stable, people take better care of  their health concern for the  environment is on the rise and, um,  let's see, there's an entire  television channel dedicated to golf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so bad once you get used to  it. The Nineties are about  responsibility. You know, having  respect for yourself and other people.  I even got married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You? Married? What about the sexual  revolution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it turns out there were some  casualties, baby. Don't you think  you'll ever get married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not until I get a little more  'experience' under my belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, behave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Austin notices something outside and puts his ha to his mouth in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wide-eyed) Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicity is immediately on her guard. She pulls her gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) What is it! Is it Fat Bastard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, written here on my hand, see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin turns his hand around to show her. He has written my God' on his hand with the pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says 'Oh my God!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Felicity duck into a CAMERA SHOP and come out instant later with SUPER-8 CAMERAS. They run down the street filming each other.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTIN AND FELICITY
dialogues.text: This is a Richard Lester-like sequence shot on grainy fil from Austin and Felicity's POVs. There's lots of SPEEDED UP stuff and POPPING IN AND OUT o frame like the MONKEES TV show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicity, I haven't had this much  fun since I worked undercover in  Amsterdam-- '66 I think it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1965, actually. You posed as a Dutch  cheese expert to stop Dr.  Evil from  poisoning the world's water supply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've studied your file, Austin. I  want to be a trailblazer, just like  you.  The Seventies are right around  the corner. It's going to be a  glorious time for fashion and music  and technology-- it won't be long  before every flying car has its own  8-track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin starts to say something, then bites his tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CIA has always been a boy's club  until now. Well move over, this  chick's taking over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse) Very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, your voice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I think I'm coming down with  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Felicity stop at an ICE CREAM MAN with his  pushcart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get some ice cream. Would you  like some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse, to ice cream  man) Could I have two scoops of Vanilla,  please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right away, governor. Would you like  chocolate syrup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse) Yes, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you have any whipped cream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse) I will, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy sprinkles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse) Yes please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crushed nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, laryngitis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your change, sir. Oh, and  Austin--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cut back to the ICE CREAM MAN to see him pulling off a very fake beard. It is BASIL (though it was clearly anoth actor before).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now with phlegmy  throat) Basil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Austin. What's wrong with  your voice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still phlegmy throat) I just had ice cream. Listen to me,  I have dairy throat.  "Mary had a  little lamb and it was always  gruntin'. She tied it to a five bar  gate and kicked it's little-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting) Austin! Things are heating up, so I  thought it best to contact you in  disguise. Felicity, your plan worked.  You and Austin track Fat Bastard  back to Dr. Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how can we track Fat Bastard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I planted a homing device on him  last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and we're starting to pick up  the signal now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basil hands Felicity a tracking device that BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get close enough to plant  a homing device?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shagged him, I shagged him rotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Basil are confused and grossed out at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... him? Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Austin, we needed that  information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks to your effort, Felicity,  we now know that-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting, to  Felicity) Did you use an elaborate set of  pulleys? A block and tackle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, you two follow the signal  back to Dr. Evil's headquarters and  then-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting, to  Felicity) I just can't get my head around it,  baby. You're so small and he's so  ... not small. The sheer mechanics  of it are mindboggling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind, Austin, you two have  work to do. You must find Dr.  Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the BEEP-BEEP of the tracking screen built into t dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it! A Chinese basket with a  counter-weighted ballast.  That's  how you did it, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, it almost sounds like you're  jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, me? That's not possible, baby! (beat, to himself) is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then a-car pulls beside them. Two Dr. Evil Private A guys pull machine guns and start SHOOTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicity ducks. Austin reaches back and pulls ROBIN SWALL from the back seat and USES HER AS A SHIELD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're obviously on the right track. (re: tracking screen) It looks like Fat Bastard is-on an  island in the middle of the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the BEEP-BEEP of the tracking screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beetle comes from under the water and lands on the be We still hear the BEEP-BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Felicity have set up a tent with a view of the Dr.  Evil Mt. Rushmore face. Austin is looking at the mou through a pair of binoculars which hang around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the readings, Dr. Evil's  headquarters is over the next ridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin hands her the binoculars. Unfortunately the strap still around his neck, pulling his face into her cleavage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Question is, how do we get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) Mmmmmmm...mmmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, did you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seem to be stuck in your dirty  pillows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the topographical maps  that Basil drew up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're in the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Felicity enter the tent. A LIGHT is on inside cast shadows of Austin and Felicity on the side of the tent. F the outside it appears the shadow Austin is leaning over  with his back to-the shadow Felicity, who appears to have her hands up his butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got it out yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Lord, Austin, what sort of things  do you put in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shadow Felicity appears to be tugging a string of sau links from his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, anything that catches my fancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you manage to fit it all in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it stretches to fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shadow Felicity appears to pull a tennis racket out o Austin's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you almost done? I can't hold it  much longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that Austin is leaned over holding part of the ten Felicity is rummaging through a duffel bag across the ten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go, one hammer. It's amazing  how much this duffel bag will hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Dr. Evil playing a piano. We pan to see Mini-Me on top of the piano, himself playing a miniature baby grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) 'WHAT IF GOD WAS ONE OF US? JUST A SLOB LIKE ONE OF US?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that Number Two and Frau are the audience. They  applaud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil, that was fantastic, but I  do have some bad news.  Powers' is  on the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How tedious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Dr. Evil, we can get to  him by using the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the perfect weapon. Frau?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Bring in the He-Bots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: It's Rainina Men by THE WEATHERGIRLS Three HE-BOTS enter in unison. They are robotic studs in Logan's Run ty outfits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil, may I present the He-Bots.  What kind of woman could resist these  perfect specimens of masculinity?  Their clothes are stylish, their  posture is ramrod straight, and their  buttocks are tight, like tigers.  And, each He-Bot is armed with a  secret weapon.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST HE-BOT.
dialogues.text: A nozzle flips up from his codpiece and white smoke pours out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poison gas...

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND HE-BOT.
dialogues.text: A gun barrel flips out form his crotch and FIRES machine- style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machine gun...

dialogues.speaker: THE THIRD HE-BOT.
dialogues.text: A nozzle flips up from his crotch and yellow liquid drizz out onto the floor, where it smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And deadly acid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil is disgusted by the last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I object to the last one on  aesthetic grounds, but I don't care  how you get Powers, just bring him  to me. (to Mini-Me) Ready Mini-Me? A one and a two and... (singing) ME, AND MY SHA-DOW STROLLING DOWN  THE A-VA- (rapidly) WASN'T A STREET, WASN'T A ROAD WASN'T A BOULEVARD (dancing in step) ME, AND MY SHA- OW ALL ALONE AND FEE- LING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice unnaturally  low) BLUE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the shadows again. It now looks like Felicity is  putting things into Austin's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want everything to go back  in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Listen, Felicity, about Fat  Bastard-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my job, Austin. You of all people  should understand that.  Marakesh,  1962. Rome, 1964. Tokyo, 1966. I  know your record backwards and  forwards.  You've had more sex on  the job than a Swedish stewardess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shadow Felicity tries to cram the tennis racket into  what appears to be Austin's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Felicity, I can't deny  it. But the world changed, and I  changed too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back to reveal that THE HE-BOTS are watching. Felici shoves the tennis racket extra hard. Austin stands up rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! (beat) My back hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, just keeping packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The He-Bots shrug their shoulders and march towards the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil, Fat Bastard, Scott, Number Two and Frau are sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ Almighty, it smells terrible  in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the volcanic sulphurous  emissions. We've put up some air  fresheners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, now it smells like someone  took a shite in a pine tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil, the laser has been loaded  into the rocket. You're ready for  launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just waiting to taunt my nemesis.  I have so few pleasures, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Felicity are brought in at gunpoint by Private Army Men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Mr. Powers, Ms. Shagwell, welcome  to my hollowed-out volcano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We meet again, Dr. Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the only reason I'm keeping you  alive is so you can feel the agony  of watching my plan unfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil your plan will never--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin trails off as he spots his MOJO in the beaker behi Dr.  Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is that yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mojo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they say: finders  keepers, loser weepers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil, do you like real estate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicity kicks Dr. Evil in the balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you've got a couple of achers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oww! My stomach hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wincing) I don't care if he is evil, you don't  give a man a shot in the pills. It's  just not cricket, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards lead Austin and Felicity away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just hoofed you in the sack and  you're going to leave them alone in  a jail cell with one inept guard?  They'll escape, dipshit. You do this  every time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going the right way for a  smacked bottom, young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't own me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do actually. (pulling out paper) It's complicated. Usually it's illegal  but this buddy of mine... but I  digress. Fat Bastard, I'm leaving  you in charge. I'm going up the moon  to hold the world ransom with my  giant laser, I shouldn't be long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Powers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's tucked away safely in his cell.  He's harmless without that mojo.  Guard it with your life. (to Number Two) Number Two, begin the countdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The area around Dr. Evil's command chair, including the t portal behind it, is enclosed by a circular door, becomin part of the rocket. Steam begins billowing, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five, four, three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two, one, liftoff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocket lifts off from the volcano into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocket in flight.

dialogues.speaker: FULL SCREEN
dialogues.text: The rocket enters the screen. It has the silhouette of a  flying penis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, you better have a look at  this radar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, sir, but it looks like  a giant--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look out of starboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, it looks like a huge--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pecker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there. A rare red-billed  woodpecker! (looks over with  binoculars) What sort of bird is that? Oh  goodness, it's not a bird, it's-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Privates! We have reports of an  Unidentified Flying Object. It has a  long, smooth shaft, complete with-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two balls! No strikes. (looking up) What is that? It looks just like an  enormous--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the horn to British  Intelligence and let them know about  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Felicity are in a bare cell with cement walls. The huge metal door has a window with bars in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we going to get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just shag Fat Bastard  again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) Austin, that is it! I don't know  what happened to you in the Nineties,  but I'm still here, in the Sixties,  and I still swing! Don't try to lay  your hang-ups on me just because you  lost your mojo! That one hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch, baby, very ouch. I'm wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Austin, that was a cheap  shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, baby, you're right. I was wrong  to judge you. I guess I am... jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Austin Powers I knew was  wild and crazy and free. He could  never be jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Austin is gone. I've changed. I  knew someone, not long ago, a very  special woman. She taught me that  life isn't about jumping into the  sack with whoever comes along, it's  about caring and responsibility. And  while it is true she turned out to  be an evil robot minion of Dr. Evil,  I suppose I really did... love her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Vanessa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicity is touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Austin, I can't pretend to  understand everything you've gone  through, but I trust you. I'll make  you a deal: if we get out of here  alive, I'll give monogamy a try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groovy, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to lure the guard inside and  get his key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, what if I pretend to be  desperately ill with food poisoning?  The guard, drawn by my cries of pain,  will come to investigate.  Meanwhile,  you dig a pit and line it with  makeshift punji sticks made from  sharpened toothbrushes. The guard  falls in, Bob's your uncle, and we've  got the key.  What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Almost... got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin falls flat on his face with a THUMP and pops back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a stark, steel girder and glass structure. Dr. Evil trying to look dignified but he is FLOATING AWAY. He grab at the railing of his chair as his feet float up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone seen my gravity booties?  Honestly, all I wanted was a frickin'  moon base. Hello, we're on the moon,  no gravity? (calling out) Mini-Me? Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: THE TOP OF THE ROOM.
dialogues.text: Mini-Me is stuck to the top of the ceiling along with a l of DEBRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My frickin' mascot is stuck to the  ceiling, OK? Not good. Papa not happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Somebody get the stick. Hold on,  Mini-Me. (into microphone) Begin laser-

dialogues.text: He's interrupted by terrible FEEDBACK. Dr. Evil taps and  blows on the mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone). Begin-

dialogues.text: Worse FEEDBACK. He holds it farther away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic) Begin laser ignition sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laser's coils begin to glow RED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunar alignment in 6 hours.

dialogues.speaker: FULL FRAME
dialogues.text: A NORAD-type screen showing the current position of the m and where it needs to be before the laser can fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Felicity run into the Main Room. It is strange dark and quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your mojo, Austin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: It's Raining Men by THE WEATHERGIRLS Suddenly, the lights dim. The three He-Bots descend from the ceiling on trapezes and acrobatic rings, their muscles rippling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out, baby, He-Bots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The He-Bots flip off their trapezes and land in unison, l a perfect Olympic dismount. Their crotch nozzles flip up by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't fight them without my mojo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said anything about fighting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: seductive music Felicity does a very seductive dan with hip thrusts and bumps and grinds. The He-Bots EXPLOD succumbing to her mojo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smashing, Felicity, you were making  me very horny, man! Extremely randy,  indeed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, give the lads a show. Take of  your top. Put 'em on the glass! Make  'em bounce. Let's have a look at  your tits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Felicity turn to see Fat Bastard lurking in th background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat Bastard!

dialogues.text: Looking for this, Mr. Powers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me back my mojo, Fat Bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give the orders, (bleep) for brains.  Guards, take them back to their cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, let me ask you one question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I guess I owe you that much  for a night of carnal ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin is grossed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of stupid ass question is  that? I'm (bleep)in' rich and I'm up  to my tits in clean stinky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't answer my question, are  you happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about my girth isn't it? Sure I  could lose a few pounds, but I could  shiva git!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm not happy. Look at me,  I'm a big fat slob. I've got bigger  titties than you do! I've got more  (bleep)in' chins than a Chinese phone  book.  I've got more crack cheese  than a (bleep)in' dairy. I've nay  seen ma willie in two years. That's  enough time to declare it legally  deed! I can't stop eating. I eat  because I'm unhappy and I'm unhappy  because I eat. (starts to cry) I'm caught in a cycle and there's no  escape!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe inside that Fat Bastard there's  a thin bastard, trying to get out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there's big crap inside me  trying to get out, jack-ass!  Enough  of your (bleep)in' new age aphorisms.  Listen, I've run the gamut of self-  help books.  "Food isn't love", right,  but how do you get it from the page  to the (bleep)in' fork?  I'm so weak,  I hate myself. I'm for shite. Here,  take the mojo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat Bastard hands over the mojo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate you trying to reach me,  no one can do it for me, I know this  now.  There's a hole in my soul that  food won't fill. This is the beginning  of a new me. I'm gonna go to the gym  everyday. If you'll excuse me, there's  someone I have to get in touch with  and forgive... myself. (pause) Sorry. I farted. (pause) It's a long road ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Felicity run up to the Beetle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, I have something very  important to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin drinks the mojo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound as a pound, my spuds are  boiling. Fancy a shag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, we don't have time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, luv, let's hop on the good  foot and do the bad thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil's taken his laser to the  moon. The world is in danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, the moon. I think I know  someone who can give us a lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Apollo ready for lift-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been some sort of delay in  the launch of Apollo 11, Walter, but  we understand that America's first  manned mission to the moon will be  blasting off shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pan across Austin in a spacesuit, then Felicity in her  spacesuit, then CAMEO ASTRONAUT in his space suit. They a surrounded by hundreds of gauges, buttons and meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gor blimey, you'd have to be a rocket  scientist to figure this stuff out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a rocket scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A technician closes the hatch and the countdown begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will have lift-off in T minus 10  seconds... 9... 8... etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicity, if you get frightened,  just hold my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocket lifts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have lift-off! Apollo 11 has  cleared the tower and is heading for  a rendezvous with the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The G-forces during lift-off are incredible. Austin's fac is pulled into a contorted mask which bares his teeth. Hi hair sticks straight up and his glasses are twisted. Austin is terrified. He clutches Felicity's hand, then gr on to the astronaut beside him. Felicity, however, loves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Yaaaaa-hoooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stages separate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basil sits at the console with NASA technicians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, you have achieved lunar orbit.  How was that lift-off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be honest it was terrifying. It  felt like sitting on top of a bomb.  As I punched through the atmosphere,  I said 'Oh my God!' and I soiled  myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happens all the time in that  situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean I soiled myself just now  when I said oh 'my God!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basil, it was amazing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare for moon landing. We only  have one hour until Dr. Evil fires  the laser!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lunar module settles on the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mission control, the swinger has  landed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin and Felicity step out in their spacesuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one small step for man, but  a giant step for shagging.  Can you  imagine it, baby, weightless? The  permutations are mind-boggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naughty boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin plants a UNION JACK on the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God Save the Queen.

dialogues.text: The MISSION COMMANDER shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen? This is an American show,  goddammit. Let's roll that footage  we shot last week in the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family gathers around the TV, watching Neil Armstrong's 'real' moon landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Evil walks all the way around a TUBULAR HALLWAY-- up walls, across the ceiling upside down, and back again,  settling into his chair. It is like that shot in 2001 SPA ODYSSEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Position the laser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laser shifts into place. An ALARM goes off and LIGHTS FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WARNING, LASER CALIBRATION!

dialogues.text: Get me the President.

dialogues.text: Mr. President, your time is up. This  is your last chance to pay 100 billion  dollars or see Washington DC  destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WARNING, LASER CALIBRATION!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ALARM continues to blare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I can't hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay me 100 billion dollars or see  Washington DC destroyed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ALARM BLARES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I just can't hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder) How about now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Capital will be destroyed-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ALARM BLARES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry! I just can't- I think it's  that alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could someone shut off that frickin'  alarm? I'm trying to hold the free  world hostage here. Honestly. (shouting) WILL DESTROY WASHINGTON DC UNLESS  YOU PAY ME-

dialogues.text: The ALARM SHUTS OFF but Dr. Evil is still shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) 100 BILLION DOLLARS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His yelling startles even himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Dr. Evil, be reasonable. That's  more money than is in the entire  Federal Treasury!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well, I guess you have one minute  to- "show me the money"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't know what that means.  I can't show you the money because  we don't have the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I suppose you're up shit's crick  without a paddle.

dialogues.text: A white room with a bank of old-fashioned computers and a tracking screen. Basil, several GENERALS, and other VIPs  look anxiously over the shoulder of the MISSION CONTROL  SPECIALISTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, Austin has landed on the  moon. We'll soon know whether he has  succeeded or whether the world will  be destroyed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's find Dr. Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points. We see a profile through a sheet of frosted gl It is Dr. Evil's distinctive profile, with a machine gun. Austin takes careful aim and FIRES.  We see the SHADOW ta the hit, and fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, you've done it! You got Dr.  Evil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I did, baby, I got my mojo  working overtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, I'm going ahead. Cover my  rear!

dialogues.text: Oh, behave!

dialogues.text: Felicity runs ahead. Austin runs over to where the shadow came from. He sees that it was not Dr. Evil, but MINI-ME, carrying a little gun. Austin is ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor little bugger. He's so small,  he's like a dog or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin chokes back a tear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor little bugger. (realizing) Felicity, be careful! Dr. Evil is  still alive! Felicity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin runs after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin rounds the corner and comes upon Dr. Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding his gun on  Dr. Evil) Alright, slap-head, turn around.  Slowly.

dialogues.text: Aren't you forgetting something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicity! (to Dr. Evil) What have you done to her?

dialogues.text: Don't worry, she's not dead... yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brightly colored GAS starts to fill the glass chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled through glass) Don't worry about me Austin. You've  got to save the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like you have a choice,  Powers: save the world, or save your  girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin is torn. He looks back and forth between Felicity the laser which is on the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got my mojo back, man, I can do  both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see. Fire the laser!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman manning the laser's joystick begins to MOVE IT. Austin leaps across the room and reaches her just in time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands off my joystick, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laser beam hits the Big Boy Rocket in the crotch and Boy's eyes cross in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you, Powers!
